He or she is the leader of a political coalition in the [[National Assembly of Hungary]] and the leader of the [[Government of Hungary|cabinet]]. The current Prime Minister is [[Viktor OrbÃ¡n]], who has served since 29 May 2010. ==Official title== The title of Hungary's head of government in Hungarian is ''miniszterelnÃ¶k''. Literally translated, this means "[[Minister-President]]". However, because "[[Prime minister]]" or "[[premier]]" is the more usual title in a parliamentary system for a head of government in English-speaking nations, the head of the Hungarian government is usually referred to by English speakers as the "Prime Minister of Hungary". ==Election and appointment of the Prime Minister== The Prime Minister is officially appointed by the [[President of Hungary]]. According to the [[Constitution of Hungary|Hungarian Constitution]], the President shall appoint the leader of the political party with the [[parliamentary majority|majority of the votes]] in the [[Hungarian Parliament|Parliament]] as Prime Minister. If there is no party with a majority, the leader of the largest party is asked to attempt to form a government. Therefore, the election of members of a certain party to parliament is the equivalent to a vote for that party's leader for Prime Minister. ==History of the office== [[File:Tyroler Batthyany kormany.jpg|thumb|left|The first government of Hungary]] ===Palatine of Hungary=== {{main|Palatine (Kingdom of Hungary)}} The '''palatine''' ({{lang-la|comes palatii, comes palatinus}}, later ''{{lang|la|palatinus (regni)}}'', {{lang-hu|nÃ¡dorispÃ¡n/ nÃ¡dor}}, {{lang-sk|nÃ¡dvornÃ½ Å¾upan/ nÃ¡dvornÃ½ Å¡pÃ¡n}}, later: ''{{lang|sk|palatÃ­n / nÃ¡dvornÃ­k}}'', {{lang-de|Palatin}}) was the highest dignitary in the [[Kingdom of Hungary]] after the [[monarch|king]] (a kind of powerful [[Prime Minister]] and supreme judge) from the kingdom's rise up to 1848/1918. Initially, he was in fact the representative of the king, later the vice-regent ([[viceroy]]). In the early centuries of the kingdom, he was appointed by the king, later elected by the [[Diet (assembly)|Diet]] of the Kingdom of Hungary. After the [[Habsburg]]s solidified their hold of Hungary, the dignity became an appointed position once again. Finally, it became hereditary in a cadet (junior) branch of the Habsburg dynasty after [[Francis II, Holy Roman Emperor|King Francis]] appointed his brother [[Archduke Joseph, Palatine of Hungary|Joseph]]. ===Creation of the position=== {{main|Hungarian Revolution of 1848}} During the Hungarian Revolution of 1848 the revolutionaries wanted the creation of a Hungarian cabinet which would be independent from the [[Austrian Empire]] and the Buda Chancellery (which was office of the Imperial Governor-General). One of the [[12 points of the Hungarian Revolutionaries of 1848|12 points]] said: ''2. A responsible government in [[Buda]]-[[Pest, Hungary|Pest]].'' [[Ferdinand I of Austria|Ferdinand V]] appointed Count [[Lajos BatthyÃ¡ny]] for the position of Prime Minister of Hungary on 17 March 1848.
